Articles.Content:
A few KSP years ago (6 to be exact), I sent two identical craft into an orbit around Kerbin in order to complete my first completely manual docking described in this tutorial: http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Tutorial:_Gemini_6A_and_7. I docked the two craft and left them there for about 6 KSP years, being to busy to recover the kerbals and not wanting to de-orbit a historic site. About a week ago, though, I decided to recover the kerbals from the craft. I brought up my standard recovery craft and EVA'ed the kerbals over.

One thing I noticed was that Jebediah was smiling insanely and did so throughout the whole mission. The other three kerbals were acting normally. I landed the craft and am now preparing for a mission to Laythe, but Jeb hasn't stopped smiling! It's starting to scare me now. Anyone else having the problem?

Jeb in the recovery vehicle

This is not out of the normal.

Judging by join date, you must be new here.

I still sorta am, but I like to know I played just before it went p2p.

Well yeah, he's Jeb.

Now strap him to an SRB and watch the fireworks. (I meant that figuratively, but oh well )
Perfectly normal. The only way to get that guy to stop smiling is to fly a rocket at mach 4 straight into the ground, but even then results can't be guaranteed.
Nothing out of the ordinary, citizen. Jeb's always been like that
I had no idea that this was completely normal. Oh well, it does add some excitement to future missions!
Put him into a capsule on the launch pad and throw a fuel tank next to it. He'll stop immediately... for a while.

I love the expression on the other kerbal. 6 years on the job with Jeb, and counting.

Just another ordinary day in the Kerbal Space Program.

I sent Jeb and another Kerbal (Can't remember exactly which) I sent him on a moon walk, I found the Neil Armstrong easter egg, but it was ages away from my landing site. So he went out, and I got bored halfway and I wasn't bothered to get him back. So I just left him lying on the floor (I pretended he was in Cryosleep) he's still there now, about 3 Ksp years on. Don't want to find out what his facial expression is now.....
jeb was always insane. he just hid it from most.
This is because Jeb is badass. True Story
That is a great screenshot! I'm still laughing at the other Kerbal's look. This needs a caption contest!
Haha, you brewed him up for six years in orbit? Make sure carefully count the number of SRB's on your next launch...

I've only seen Jeb not smiling once... for just a second.

It was an SSTO test flight that went horribly bad. At about 22km the craft lost lift and started re-entry at about 1200m/s... with Farren & Deadly Re-entry mods. Parts started exploding and ripping off and Jeb frowned for a second as he went into a lunch expelling spin.

Amazingly he was able to (crash) land the craft with just 1 wing (no ailerons), a rudder, and the rocket engine. (Just the cockpit survived.)

And yes, Jeb was smiling insanely the rest of the way down.
I've always imagined Jebediah has a personality similar to the "Space" personality-core from Portal 2.
This is how to fix it
